verses.verse: Paul’s Ministry to the Gentiles This is the reason that I, Paul, am a prisoner for (Or of) Christ Jesus (Other ancient authorities lack Jesus) for the sake of you gentiles,
for surely (Or if indeed) you have already heard of the commission of God’s grace that was given me for you
(Acts 22.17; Rom 16.25; Gal 1.12) and how the mystery was made known to me by revelation, as I wrote above in a few words, (Or wrote before in brief)
(1 Cor 4.1) a reading of which will enable you to perceive my understanding of the mystery of Christ.
(Rom 16.26) In former generations this mystery (Gk it) was not made known to humankind, as it has now been revealed to his holy apostles and prophets by the Spirit:
(Gal 3.29; Eph 2.15, 16) that is, the gentiles have become fellow heirs, members of the same body, and sharers in the promise in Christ Jesus through the gospel.
Of this gospel I have become a servant according to the gift of God’s grace that was given me by the working of his power.
(1 Cor 15.9; Gal 1.16; Col 1.27) Although I am the very least of all the saints, this grace was given to me to bring to the gentiles the news of the boundless riches of Christ
(Col 1.26, 27) and to make everyone see (Other ancient authorities read to bring to light) what is the plan of the mystery hidden for ages in (Or by) God, who created all things,
(1 Cor 2.7; Eph 1.21; 1 Pet 1.12) so that through the church the wisdom of God in its rich variety might now be made known to the rulers and authorities in the heavenly places. (Gk heavenlies)
This was in accordance with the eternal purpose that he has carried out in Christ Jesus our Lord,
(Eph 2.18; Heb 4.16) in whom we have access in boldness and confidence through faith in him. (Or the faith of him)
I pray, therefore, that you (Or I) may not lose heart over my sufferings for you; they are your glory.
Prayer for the Readers For this reason I bow my knees before the Father, (Other ancient authorities add of our LORD Jesus Christ)
from whom every family (Gk fatherhood) in heaven and on earth takes its name.
(Rom 7.22; Eph 1.18; Col 1.11) I pray that, according to the riches of his glory, he may grant that you may be strengthened in your inner being with power through his Spirit
and that Christ may dwell in your hearts through faith, as you are being rooted and grounded in love.
(Job 11.8, 9; Eph 1.18) I pray that you may have the power to comprehend, with all the saints, what is the breadth and length and height and depth
(Eph 1.23; Col 2.10) and to know the love of Christ that surpasses knowledge, so that you may be filled with all the fullness of God.
(Rom 16.25) Now to him who by the power at work within us is able to accomplish abundantly far more than all we can ask or imagine,
to him be glory in the church and (Other ancient authorities omit and) in Christ Jesus to all generations, forever and ever. Amen.
